alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 11:44AM CDT until July 17 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Osage County in northeastern Oklahoma... Washington County in northeastern Oklahoma... Western Nowata County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1230 PM CDT. * At 1144 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles south of Cedar Vale to near Havana, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Nowata... Dewey... Copan... Ochelata... Delaware... Lenapah... Wann... Bigheart... Bartlesville Municipal Airport... Hulah... Sunset Lake... Osage Hills State Park... Watova... Okesa... Wah Sha She State Park... Tallant... Nelagoney... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
